toolTips.title: Basic Service Charge
toolTips.description: A fixed daily or monthly amount that covers the cost to provide service to your location. These charges are billed monthly regardless of any service used.

toolTips.title: Energy Charges
toolTips.description: The monthly Energy Charge includes all other costs of producing the electricity you purchase, except fuel. This includes conservation, environmental and capacity cost recovery charges.

toolTips.title: Fuel Charges
toolTips.description: Cost of fuel used to produce electricity you purchased. Fuel costs are passed through from fuel suppliers to our customers with no markup or profit to Tampa Electric.

toolTips.title: Storm Protuction Charges
toolTips.description: The cost of additional hardening efforts to further protect the power grid from hurricanes or other extreme weather events.

toolTips.title: Clean Energy Transition Mechanism
toolTips.description: A charge to recover costs associated with electric meter upgrades and the closing of certain coal generating plants to supports Tampa Electric’s transition to produce clean energy.

toolTips.title: Avarage kWh per day
toolTips.description: A kilowatthour (kWh) is a unit of energy used by an electrical device during a given period.

toolTips.title: Bright Choices
toolTips.description: The associated fees and charges for leased outdoor lighting services.

toolTips.title: Sun To Go
toolTips.description: The amount of electricity purchased from solar generating sources serving the Sun to Go program, which provides optional renewable energy purchases in 200 kWh blocks.

toolTips.title: Share
toolTips.description: A Peoples Gas program administered by the Salvation Army and Catholic Charities that helps pay energy bills of customers in need. If you choose to contribute, your contribution is tax deductible and is matched by Peoples Gas.

toolTips.title: Budget Billing
toolTips.description: A Peoples Gas program administered by the Salvation Army and Catholic Charities that helps pay energy bills of customers in need. If you choose to contribute, your contribution is tax deductible and is matched by Peoples Gas.

toolTips.title: Rate Schedule
toolTips.description: The amount {rate) you pay depends on your customer category. The cost of providing service varies with the customer group.

toolTips.title: Buried Piping Notification
toolTips.description: Federal regulations require that Peoples Gas notify our customers who own buried piping of the following: 1) When excavating near buried gas piping, the piping should be located in advance; 2) The gas supplier does not own or maintain the customer’s buried piping; 3) Buried piping that is not maintained may be subject to corrosion and/or leakage. Buried piping should be inspected periodically and any unsafe conditions repaired. Licensed plumbers, heating and air conditioning contractors, or Peoples Gas can conduct inspections.
